content.description: Up the face to five bolts and the anchor.
content.location: On the left most wall at Upper West there are two climbs on the short wall. This one is the right of the two.

content.description: Easy climb up to 2-3 crimpy moves (crux) ending with a big jug. There is a bolted anchor on the private property ledge. No stick clip is necessary. Nice way to gain the private property ledge.
content.location: Directly below trespassing and phantom ticks. 15' right of breaking and Entering.

content.description: Climb past a high first bolt, through the slightly overhanging face with left leaning small overlap. Hard climbing below leads to easier and easier terrain above. Trend right at the overhang, then left to the LO. Fun route that requires multiple techniques.
content.location: Located to the left of Take Back Vermont. Climb Trespassing Direct (5.10a), or scramble left past the Take Back Vermont slab to gain access to the belay ledge. The climb starts just right of a rotten hole, behind a large boulder. Private Property (5.8+) is the bolt line directly left, on the same ledge.

content.description: This route goes up the steep face and blunt arête/right facing corner.The crux is around the first couple bolts, then it eases up towards the top. It's easy to make this feel harder than 10b.
content.location: Directly right of Take Back Vermont.

content.description: Nice face climbing with a tricky bulge half way up. After reaching through that, easier climbing leads to the anchors.
content.location: At the top of the trail leading to the Upper Tier, take the left fork to a rock slab. Climb the nice looking black face about 30 feet left of a right facing corner.

content.description: A radventure of broken holds and crumbly choss.Climb a steep section to a high first bolt. A stick clip may be necessary for those weary at the grade. Pull higher on good holds to reach easier ground. Romp ahead through a small runout (5.4) to a stance below a vertical face. Make delicate moves past a small runout (hollow rock prevented a bolt from being placed) before reaching big flakes and a fun layback feature to the top with a two-bolt anchor.Numerous holds have broken... this is likely 5.10 now. Admittedly this may be the worst route I've ever bolted. Enjoy?
content.location: 10 feet right of Corkscrew. The first line of bolts when hiking to the South End from the main trail junction.

content.description: Delicate face climbing on vertical rock gains the anchors.
content.protection: Bolts with two bolt anchor. One bolt down low for anchoring belayer.
content.location: To the right of Breaking and Entering is a short (3 bolt) chossy climb that gains access to the belay ledge called trespassing direct (5.10a). You can also scramble up to the ledge. There are 3 climbs on the belay ledge, the leftmost is Private Property (5.8+) the middle one is Trespassing (5.10a) and the rightmost is called phantom thicks.

content.description: Short, fun crimpy climb with great exposure for its length. Best to avoid the urge to exit out right to the loose rock near the dead tree after the second bolt, and instead to trend left through some tricky sidepulls.
content.location: Furthest to the right of the three climbs on the Private Property/Trespassing ledge

content.description:
Also known as "Home Depot" 

  Up the face to four bolts and the anchor.
content.location: On the left most wall at Upper West there are two climbs on the short wall.  This one is the left of the two.

content.description:
Also known as "Corkscrew"

 Start on a blunt arete to the right of a corner and go up to four bolts. Step left onto a large grassy ledge then up another face with four bolts to the chain anchors. The climbing gets tougher above the ledge before a solid stance at the anchor chains.
content.location: Around the corner from "It's Not A Cruise" and "True Value" follow the cliff to a washed out and dirty platform like belay spot.

content.description: When hiking up to the main junction in the midst of the boulder pile, these routes are up and to the left. Around the left (south) side houses True Value & Home Depot. The dark (sometimes wet) face is Take Back Vermont/Take Back Vermont From Behind and the ledge to the left is often referred to as the Trespassing Ledge. It houses 3 sport climbs.
